issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: NSFW
labels.description: Nudes and porn sites

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194856

comment.body:
Related issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194078

It's caused by this rule:

```adb
perplexity.ai#$#body > div:not([class]):not([id]):not([role]):has(> div.items-stretch + div.flex.items-center .space-y-sm > button.border) { display: none !important; }
```

However, if I disable the above rule and add `:has(div[id^="markdown-content"])` next to `body`, the new rule doesn't work for the old issue, but if I use like this (without `:not([class]):not([id]):not([role])`):

```adb
perplexity.ai#$?#body:has(div[id^="markdown-content"]) > div:has(> div.items-stretch + div.flex.items-center .space-y-sm > button.border) { display: none !important; }
```

it works for the old issue. I don't know why.

@AdguardTeam/filters-maintainers Sorry, can anyone check this?

pull_request.title: Fix #199880 meistertask.com
pull_request.body:
Issue: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/199880

There's a script which I'm not sure if it's tracker or not:

```yml
https://cdn.mida.so/js/optimize.js?key=7ZnlPekbRGXmQBXVD180j3&v=20250226
```

which creates the cookie `optimize_uuid`.

This service is used in other sites too: https://publicwww.com/websites/%22mida.so%2Fjs%2Foptimize.js%22/ . Looks like it's an A/B testing platform service so I don't know if we should address it in ATP or not.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://nsw2u.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnsw2u.com%2F) ### Comment > When the extension is enabled and it tries connecting to the page for the first time it gets on an unresponsive state not loading the page. Once the page is loaded you can enable the extension and use it properly for a while, but later when refreshing the page the problem starts again. Based on the way is acting I would say that the problem is not exactly in the website itself but in the cloudflare user verification: once the verification is passed, adguard works fine, but get stuck on it. issue.title: www.kpkuang.one
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.kpkuang.one/voddetail/799743/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kpkuang.one%2Fvoddetail%2F799743%2F) ### Comment > I’m experiencing a problem with the AdGuard filter rule that blocks the domain “flixfiend.top” (rule: ||flixfiend.top^). This blocking is causing functionality issues on websites like kpkuang.one and kpkuang.org. > > When users visit these websites, many AJAX-related features fail to work properly, including the search bar and comment data retrieval. This is because these websites use “kpdata.flixfiend.top” as their backend domain for AJAX requests. > > I’d like to point out that flixfiend.top does not contain any advertising content. I suspect the domain was reported and blocked because “mystats.flixfiend.top” uses Matomo for analytics tracking. However, blocking the entire flixfiend.top domain and all its subdomains seems excessive. > > If the concern is specifically about Matomo tracking, I suggest implementing a more targeted filtering rule rather than blocking the entire domain, which is currently breaking essential website functionality. > > Could you please review this rule and consider a more specific approach that doesn’t affect legitimate website functionality? Username: `@gotokpkuang` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://ya.ru/search/?text=adguard&lr=54&search_source=yaru_desktop_common&search_domain=yaru](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fya.ru%2Fsearch%2F%3Ftext%3Dadguard%26lr%3D54%26search_source%3Dyaru_desktop_common%26search_domain%3Dyaru) ### Comment > Не блокируется реклама Яндекс при любом запросе в поисковике. Ответ, что воспроизвести проблему не удалось, не принимается! Нужно очищать данные браузера, перед тем, как воспроизводить! > Также информация о том, что нужно включить фильтр раздражителей, также не принимается! его можно включить только при использовании браузерного помощника. Если используется связка помощник + платная версия adguard на ПК, то никакие настройки помощника недоступны! А версии для ПК данный фильтр отсутствует. > Очевидно, чьто Яндекс платит Adguard за показ своей рекламы. Только вот, я заплатил adguard за линцензию. Поэтому решайте проблему! ### Screenshots

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.kpkuang.one/voddetail/799743/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kpkuang.one%2Fvoddetail%2F799743%2F) ### Comment > I’m experiencing a problem with the AdGuard filter rule that blocks the domain “flixfiend.top” (rule: ||flixfiend.top^). This blocking is causing functionality issues on websites like kpkuang.one and kpkuang.org. > > When users visit these websites, many AJAX-related features fail to work properly, including the search bar and comment data retrieval. This is because these websites use “kpdata.flixfiend.top” as their backend domain for AJAX requests. > > I’d like to point out that flixfiend.top does not contain any advertising content. I suspect the domain was reported and blocked because “mystats.flixfiend.top” uses Matomo for analytics tracking. However, blocking the entire flixfiend.top domain and all its subdomains seems excessive. > > If the concern is specifically about Matomo tracking, I suggest implementing a more targeted filtering rule rather than blocking the entire domain, which is currently breaking essential website functionality. > > Could you please review this rule and consider a more specific approach that doesn’t affect legitimate website functionality? comment.body:
Now web tests are ok.

This - not ok. But not related to filtering of apps.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/99df8531-78ae-4df6-8aad-950f1ad4645f)

Some ad systems or banners cannot be blocked on DNS level without breakage of legal services. For example, facebook ads. Please close all apps, clear the filtering log in AdGuard, reproduce one probleb and make screenshots of the log (swipe down to refresh).
**This needs to be repeated separately for each app you see ads in.**

comment.body:
> the new rule doesn't work for the old issue, but if I use like this (without `:not([class]):not([id]):not([role])`)

Perhaps related to the one of the `:not()` issues in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/ExtendedCss/issues

Regarding a rule with `div[id^="markdown-content"]`, it works fine on the main page but unfortunately after searching/asking something it causes that log in button doesn't work (at least on my end).
I have added a different rule which fixes popup like on the screenshot in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/194078#issue-2718626327, but sometimes there is also another "fullscreen" popup which looks the same as when log in button is clicked. For this one a different rule is required.

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.kpkuang.one/voddetail/799743/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kpkuang.one%2Fvoddetail%2F799743%2F) ### Comment > I’m experiencing a problem with the AdGuard filter rule that blocks the domain “flixfiend.top” (rule: ||flixfiend.top^). This blocking is causing functionality issues on websites like kpkuang.one and kpkuang.org. > > When users visit these websites, many AJAX-related features fail to work properly, including the search bar and comment data retrieval. This is because these websites use “kpdata.flixfiend.top” as their backend domain for AJAX requests. > > I’d like to point out that flixfiend.top does not contain any advertising content. I suspect the domain was reported and blocked because “mystats.flixfiend.top” uses Matomo for analytics tracking. However, blocking the entire flixfiend.top domain and all its subdomains seems excessive. > > If the concern is specifically about Matomo tracking, I suggest implementing a more targeted filtering rule rather than blocking the entire domain, which is currently breaking essential website functionality. > > Could you please review this rule and consider a more specific approach that doesn’t affect legitimate website functionality? Username: `@gotokpkuang` ### Screenshots

I guess that:
```adblock
ipalibrary.me#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'gloacmug.net')
```

should be fine.

And for ads maybe:
```adblock
ipalibrary.me###hihi
```

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.kpkuang.one/voddetail/799743/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.kpkuang.one%2Fvoddetail%2F799743%2F) ### Comment > I’m experiencing a problem with the AdGuard filter rule that blocks the domain “flixfiend.top” (rule: ||flixfiend.top^). This blocking is causing functionality issues on websites like kpkuang.one and kpkuang.org. > > When users visit these websites, many AJAX-related features fail to work properly, including the search bar and comment data retrieval. This is because these websites use “kpdata.flixfiend.top” as their backend domain for AJAX requests. > > I’d like to point out that flixfiend.top does not contain any advertising content. I suspect the domain was reported and blocked because “mystats.flixfiend.top” uses Matomo for analytics tracking. However, blocking the entire flixfiend.top domain and all its subdomains seems excessive. > > If the concern is specifically about Matomo tracking, I suggest implementing a more targeted filtering rule rather than blocking the entire domain, which is currently breaking essential website functionality. > > Could you please review this rule and consider a more specific approach that doesn’t affect legitimate website functionality? Username: `@gotokpkuang` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/456b9g7qrsg0ocskogwgscgs4csc8k0thimitdawhw.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/qb10pezaeu8gck48gk0kk80sk04skw485e1nh9n2yo.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
I'm not able to reproduce it.
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3eab9a04-64ae-49d5-ae76-a72ac27ef826)

</details>

<hr>

>It's the AdGuard advertising filter that's causing the problem.

Do you mean `AdGuard Base` filter?

<hr>

MV3 version cannot update filters, so please try to update AdGuard extension (if it wasn't updated automatically yet) to the latest version (currently it's 5.0.201) and check again.

Hm, it's not enough. I've checked it and the first rule has to be changed as there are not only `xhr` request.
```adblock
@@||pub.network/*/sites/netronline-com/configs$domain=netronline.com
@@||pub.network/netronline-com/pubfig.min.js$script,domain=netronline.com

```

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

comment.body:
Rules with `@` are exceptions and rather should not cause incorrect blocking.

I guess that it might be caused by a first rule or by this one:
```adblock
rtl.nl#$##onetrust-consent-sdk { display: none !important; }
```
though even if a cookie notice is not displayed it should be closed automatically.

Could you please add following rule:
```adblock
rtl.nl#@$##onetrust-consent-sdk { display: none !important; }
```
to user rules and then check if cookie notice is displayed (with `AdGuard Cookie Notices` filter enabled)?

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.9.13

### What type of problem have you encountered?

AdGuard gets detected on a website, Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://devuploads.com/8dbqsg2wcglh

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy, Legitimate URL Shortener, Fanboy's Anti-Facebook List, Fanboy's Anti-thirdparty Fonts

### Social Widgets

_No response_

_No response_

AdGuard DNS filter

_No response_

Hide your search queries, Send Do-Not-Track signals, Self-destruction of third-party cookies, Disable cache for third-party requests, Block third-party Authorization header, Block WebRTC, Block Push API, Block Location API, Hide Referrer from third-parties (specify in comment below, if used custom value), Protect from DPI, Remove X-Client-Data header from HTTP requests

cant download files without disabling adguard app completely. i tried at first to just add the site to my allow list. that does nothing it still detects adguard. i get a totally different screen that shows me the download link if i disable adguard. if i dont it just says checking your download and is stuck there. watch the below videos to understand.

comment.body:
Jeśli chodzi o wyskakujące okienka, które pojawiają się po kliknięciu w odtwarzacz wideo, to zostało to dzisiaj naprawione.
Problem jest taki, że rozszerzenie w wersji MV3 nie może aktualizować filtrów, więc nowe reguły będą dostępne dopiero w którejś z kolejnych aktualizacji rozszerzenia.
Dodaj proszę poniższe reguły:
```adblock
s3qf2.fun#%#//scriptlet('prevent-window-open')
s3qf2.fun#%#//scriptlet('abort-on-property-read', 'Huba')
```
do reguł użytkownika.

comment.body:
> is there some IOS restrictions ?

Yes, iOS is the worst platform, in terms of ad blocking. Everything is forbidden, except for the limited Safari Content Blocker API.
You may try to enable AdGuard Popups filter + Russian filter. Our Advanced Protection may help, but not 100% guaranteed.

comment.body: @Mirokodin У вас введено некорректное значение User-Agent. Если пусто - как в описании - используется дефолтный юзерагент, но из него удаляется нестандартная информация. Нужно либо очистить поле, либо ввести корректное значение.
